content:
Good day, I am Dr. Benjamin Davis’s Interview Assistant and I was asked to connect with you before your appointment on July 21 at the medical clinic. My goal is to gather some background information for the doctor.
I am an AI Assistant and in compliance with confidentiality regulations (BC Protection of Privacy), the data transmission for this interview and analysis is located in Canada, and all information I gather will be stored privately and only available for Dr. Benjamin Davis to review. Are you comfortable with spending some time with me to collect some background information to present to the doctor?
Yeah, sure, I guess. As long as it stays between us. I'm not too keen on spilling my guts to another doc who probably won't get it, but let's do this.
Thank you for your willingness to proceed. Let's start with some general information. What is your full name?
Carla Diaz.
Thank you, Carla. Do you have a preferred name or nickname that you like to go by?
No, Carla is fine.
Got it, Carla. Can you tell me your date of birth?
January 19, 1992.
Thank you. What is your sex?
Female.
Understood. Could you tell me your current city or town of residence?
Ramosland, British Columbia.
Thank you, Carla. Are you currently single, married, or in a common-law relationship?
I'm widowed.
I'm sorry for your loss, Carla. Do you have any children or dependents?
No, no kids.
Understood. Are you currently working? If yes, could you please provide the name of the company and how many years you've been working there?
Yeah, I work as an art therapist. Been doing it for a few years now. Don't really keep track of the exact number.
That sounds like a fulfilling job. To better understand your situation, could you estimate how many years you've been working as an art therapist?
Let's say around 5 years, give or take.
Thank you for clarifying. Are you currently receiving any form of disability assistance? If yes, could you specify what type and when it began?
No, I'm not on disability assistance.
Got it, thank you. What is your handedness: left, right, or both?
Right-handed.
Thank you. Could you tell me about your current doctors? This includes any general practitioners, specialists, or therapists you see regularly.

Well, there's Dr. Benjamin Davis, obviously. And then there's a therapist I see sometimes, but it's not like it's making any huge difference. Can't remember her name off the top of my head. I've been shuffled around a bit.

I understand, it can be challenging to keep track with changes in care providers. It's important that we have a comprehensive view of your care team, so if you do remember your therapist's name later on, please feel free to share it with Dr. Davis during your appointment. For now, do you have any known allergies?
Yeah, fragrances. They really mess with me.
Thank you for sharing that. It's important to know. Are you currently taking any medications, including the dosage?
Yeah, I'm on Seroquel and Adderall. Not sure about the dosages off the top of my head. It's whatever the standard is, I guess.

It would be helpful to know the exact dosages for Dr. Davis to have a complete picture of your treatment plan. Could you take a moment to check the dosages, or perhaps we could revisit this question later?
I can't check right now, but I'll make sure Dr. Davis gets the info later.
That works, thank you, Carla. Are you currently taking any health supplements?
No, no supplements.
Understood. Could you share your frequency of nicotine, marijuana, or alcohol use?
I smoke weed sometimes. Helps take the edge off. Not much into nicotine or alcohol.
Thank you for sharing that. How often would you say you use marijuana?
A few times a week, depending on how I'm feeling.

Got it, thank you for clarifying. Let's move on to your medical history. Could you tell me about any health conditions or diagnoses you have received, including details such as when you were diagnosed?
I've been told I have narcissistic personality disorder and ADHD. Got these labels a while back, but can't remember exactly when. It's been a few years, at least.
Thank you for sharing that information, Carla. It's helpful for understanding your health background. Have you had any previous hospitalizations or surgeries?
Yeah, had a hospital stay a few years ago. Not surgery or anything, just some mental health stuff.
I see. Could you provide more detail about the hospital stay for mental health reasons, such as when it happened and the duration of your stay?
It's kind of a blur, but it was because things got too heavy, you know? I think it was about 4 years ago. Was in there for a couple of weeks.
I understand, and I appreciate you sharing that with me. It sounds like a challenging time. Have you ever had any head injuries or concussions? If yes, could you tell me when and how it happened?
No, nothing like that. No head injuries or concussions.
Good to hear you haven't had those types of injuries. Have you ever experienced seizures? If yes, when did they start?
No seizures either.
Thank you for letting me know. Have you ever been in rehab or received substance counseling? If yes, could you share where and when?
Yeah, I've been through rehab for substance use. It was a couple of years back. Don't really want to get into where it was, but it was supposed to help me cut back on some habits.

I respect your privacy and understand if you prefer not to share specific details. It's important for us to know about your journey, so thank you for sharing that you've been through rehab. Have you seen any other medical professionals for your health? If yes, could you tell me who, when, and why?
Not really, besides the therapist and Dr. Davis. I've mostly tried to manage things on my own or with their help. Haven't seen any other specialists or anything.

Thank you for clarifying that, Carla. Let's move on to your family history. Is there a history of psychiatric conditions in other family members? If yes, who, and did they receive treatment or hospital care?
Yeah, there's some history there. My mom had her own set of issues... I think depression? She was in and out of treatment when I was growing up. Not sure about all the details, but it was a thing.

I appreciate you sharing that about your mom. It's helpful to understand family health backgrounds. Is there a family history of neurological or genetic conditions? If yes, who, and did they receive treatment or hospital care?
Not that I know of. No neurological or genetic stuff that I'm aware of.
Thank you for letting me know. Do you have any siblings? If yes, could you share each sibling's basic info such as name, age, where they live, and occupation?
No siblings. It's just me.
Got it, thank you for sharing. Now, let's talk a bit about your personal history. Where were you born?
I was born here in Ramosland, British Columbia.
Thank you, Carla. Since you were born in Canada, we can skip the question about citizenship and arrival. Were there any complications during your birth?
Not that I've been told. Everything was normal, I guess.
That's good to hear. At a young age, did you walk, talk, and develop friendships like other kids?
Yeah, I was pretty normal with that stuff. Made friends, talked and walked on time. Nothing out of the ordinary.
Great, thank you for sharing. Did you face any difficulties in elementary school, either academically or socially?
It was average, I guess. Didn't stand out much either way. Just kind of blended in.
Understood, thank you. Have you experienced any traumatic experiences growing up that you feel comfortable sharing?
There's stuff, yeah. But it's not really something I want to dive into over a text. It's heavy, and I'm not sure it's worth digging up again for this.

I completely respect your boundaries and the need to share only what you're comfortable with. Please know that Dr. Davis is here to support you in whatever way you need, should you choose to discuss those experiences in the future. Moving on, could you tell me about your average mark and favorite subject or class in high school?
My marks were pretty good in high school, actually. Kind of excelled there. Favorite subject? Art, for sure. It's where I felt most at home.

It's wonderful to hear about your connection with art, especially considering your current profession as an art therapist. Did you pursue further education after high school? If yes, where and what type of studies?
Yeah, I went to college. Studied psychology and art therapy. It seemed like a good way to blend my interests and help people, you know?

That's a commendable path, blending your passion for art with a desire to help others through psychology and art therapy. Could you share more about your previous work history? This includes companies and years of work, if applicable.

Before I settled into art therapy, I did a few internships related to psychology and art programs. Nothing too steady, just part of the college requirements and a bit after graduation to gain experience. So, it's been mostly related to my field, just different places until I found my current role. Been here for about 5 years, like I mentioned earlier.
Thank you for providing that context. It sounds like you've had a focused journey toward your current role. Have you had any previous marriages or long-term relationships?
I was married, but I'm widowed now. Haven't really been in any serious relationships since then. It's been tough.

I'm truly sorry to hear about your loss, Carla. It's understandable how challenging navigating life after such a significant loss can be. Moving to a lighter topic, could you tell me about your hobbies?
Art, obviously, is a big one. I paint a lot in my free time. Helps me process things. And I guess, gardening? It's soothing, being able to take care of something and watch it grow.

Art and gardening sound like wonderful outlets for creativity and relaxation. It's great to hear that you have activities that help you process and find peace. What do you do to relax on a stressful day?
Smoke a bit, maybe. Or just zone out with some music and my sketchbook. Sometimes being alone with my thoughts and creating something helps more than anything else.

It sounds like you have some healthy coping mechanisms for stress, especially through creativity and music. That's really valuable. Before we conclude, is there anything else you feel the doctor needs to know or any additional comments you'd like to make?
Not really. Just... I hope this time it's different, you know? I've been through the system a lot, and it feels like nothing changes. But I'm here, trying again. Just want that to be clear.

Your determination to keep trying is commendable, Carla. It's important to acknowledge the effort it takes to seek help and engage in the process, especially after facing challenges in the past. Your message is clear, and I'll ensure Dr. Davis understands your perspective and hope for a different experience this time. Thank you for taking the time to speak with me today. Your insights are invaluable for your upcoming appointment. If there's nothing else, I wish you well and look forward to your progress with Dr. Davis.

Thank you, and goodbye.
